member.name: D3D12_INDEX_BUFFER_STRIP_CUT_VALUE
member.summary: When using triangle strip primitive topology, vertex positions are interpreted as vertices of a continuous triangle “strip”. There is a special index value that represents the desire to have a discontinuity in the strip, the cut index value. This enum lists the supported cut values.

member.name: D3D12_INDEX_BUFFER_STRIP_CUT_VALUE.D3D12_INDEX_BUFFER_STRIP_CUT_VALUE_DISABLED
member.summary: Indicates that there is no cut value.

member.name: D3D12_INDEX_BUFFER_STRIP_CUT_VALUE.D3D12_INDEX_BUFFER_STRIP_CUT_VALUE_0xFFFF
member.summary: Indicates that 0xFFFF should be used as the cut value.

member.name: D3D12_INDEX_BUFFER_STRIP_CUT_VALUE.D3D12_INDEX_BUFFER_STRIP_CUT_VALUE_0xFFFFFFFF
member.summary: Indicates that 0xFFFFFFFF should be used as the cut value.
